item.title: 新山公司首次实施二级市场战略的目标是 20 亿美元
item.description: 新山资本（New Mountain Capital）的目标是为新的二级市场战略筹集多达 20 亿美元的资金，该战略将支持其他赞助商的单一资产延续基金。【原文：New Mountain Capital aims to raise as much as $2 billion for a new secondaries strategy that will back single-asset continuation funds from other sponsors.】

item.title: 沃达康、Remgro 向 7.43 亿美元光纤交易批准迈进
item.description: 南非反垄断监督机构将不会在竞争上诉法院反对沃达康集团有限公司（Vodacom Group Ltd.）和雷姆格罗有限公司（Remgro Ltd.）之间价值 132 亿兰特（7.43 亿美元）的光纤交易，这增加了交易继续进行的可能性。【原文：South Africa’s anti-trust watchdog will not oppose the 13.2 billion rand ($743 million) fiber transaction between Vodacom Group Ltd. and Remgro Ltd. at the Competition Appeal Court, increasing chances that the deal will go ahead.】

item.title: 丹格特炼油厂有望在年底前加工 100% 的尼日利亚原油
item.description: 丹格特工业有限公司（Dangote Industries Ltd.）预计，到今年年底，非洲最大的炼油厂将完全依赖尼日利亚原油，此举将取代每天数十万桶的进口石油。【原文：Dangote Industries Ltd. expects Africa’s biggest refinery to rely totally on Nigerian crude by the end of the year, a move that would replace hundreds of thousands of barrels a day of imported oil.】

item.title: 政治困境之后，英国住宅建筑商股票对博鳌亚洲论坛颇具吸引力
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）分析师认为，上周有关英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）未来的猜测引发了英国住宅建筑商股票的下跌，这提供了一个买入机会。【原文：A drop in UK homebuilder stocks fanned by last week’s speculation about the future of Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves has provided a buying opportunity, according to Bank of America Corp. analysts.】

item.title: 芯片制造商 SiPearl 在欧盟主权人工智能推动下融资 1.3 亿欧元
item.description: 欧盟支持的芯片制造商 SiPearl 已从包括台湾国泰创投（Cathay Venture）在内的投资者那里筹集了 1.3 亿欧元（约合 1.52 亿美元）的资金，因为欧洲正在推动技术主权。【原文：European Union-backed chipmaker SiPearl has raised €130 million ($152 million) from investors including Taiwan’s Cathay Venture, as Europe pushes for technological sovereignty.】

item.title: 优步交易员抛开机器人出租车风险，股价再创新高
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies Inc.【原文：Uber Technologies Inc. investors are brushing aside potential threats from self-driving competition to bet that the company has plenty of room to expand in the near term.】

item.title: 智利 6 月消费者物价跌幅为预期的两倍
item.description: 智利 6 月份的消费价格降幅是预期的两倍，将年通胀率推至 9 月份以来的最低点，并助长了央行将在本月恢复降息的预期。【原文：Chile’s consumer prices fell twice as much as expected in June, pushing annual inflation to its lowest since September and fueling expectations that the central bank will resume interest rate cuts this month.】

item.title: M&S 公司称 4 月份的网络攻击是由第三方冒名顶替造成的
item.description: 据马莎百货集团董事长阿奇-诺曼（Archie Norman）称，导致该公司运营中断数周的网络攻击是该零售商的一个第三方用户 "精心假冒 "的结果。【原文：The cyberattack that derailed Marks and Spencer Group Plc’s operations for weeks was the result of a “sophisticated impersonation” of one of the retailer’s third-party users, according to Chairman Archie Norman.】

item.title: 关税紧张局势转向其他地区，越南股市反弹
item.description: 越南股市连续第三天反弹，创下三年来的新高，因为贸易紧张局势已转向其他亚洲国家，这些国家在等待与美国达成协议的同时也面临着更高的关税。【原文：Vietnam’s stocks rallied for a third consecutive day to a three-year high as trade tensions shifted to other Asian nations facing higher tariffs while waiting to strike a deal with the US.】

item.title: 降温需求抑制新西兰房屋建筑成本
item.description: 由于新建住宅需求降温抑制了建筑业的工资和材料价格，新西兰第二季度的住宅建筑成本小幅上升。【原文：New Zealand home-building costs rose modestly in the second quarter as cooling demand for new dwellings suppresses wages and material prices in the construction industry.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚维持利率不变，紧急增税将推高房价
item.description: 罗马尼亚央行维持借贷成本不变，因为政府通过增税来控制不断膨胀的预算赤字的努力很可能会引发暂时性的通胀飙升。【原文：Romania’s central bank left borrowing costs unchanged as government efforts to rein in the ballooning budget deficit with tax hikes are likely to trigger a temporary spike in inflation.】

item.title: 美国最新就业报告发出警示信号
item.description: 最新的美国就业报告中出现了一系列值得警惕的信号，包括私营部门的招聘疲软和集中，以及工作时间的减少，这些都凸显了就业市场的脆弱。【原文：An assortment of cautionary signals emerged in the latest US jobs report, including weak and concentrated hiring in the private sector as well as a dip in hours worked that underscore a fragile job market.】

item.title: 俄罗斯原油发货量降至二月份以来最低点
item.description:
炼油运行的增长速度快于产量的增长速度，削弱了出口

。【原文：

Refining runs are rising faster than production, eating into exports

】

item.title: 挪威150亿美元石油赌注显示对长期需求的信心
item.description:
无论国际能源机构的预测如何，生产商都一心想从大陆架上榨取更多油桶。【原文：

Producers are intent on squeezing more barrels from the continental shelf regardless of International Energy Agency forecasts.

】

item.title: 最新关税暂停显示特朗普疯狂交易的局限性
item.description: 在 4 月 2 日的 "解放日 "上，唐纳德-特朗普大谈在美国工人和公司被 "掠夺 "了几十年之后，贸易终于要向有利于美国的方向倾斜了。在这位总统看来，不受约束的关税将很快使美国成为 "一个完全不同的国家"。【原文：On “Liberation Day” on April 2, Donald Trump gushed about how trade was finally going to tilt in America’s favor after decades of its workers and companies being “plundered.” For the president, unfettered tariffs would soon make the US “an entirely different country.”】

item.title: 高盛的科斯汀自五月以来第二次上调 S&P 500 指数目标
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists raised their outlook for US stocks for the second time in two months, saying they expect the Federal Reserve to act sooner to cut interest rates.】

item.title: 澳大利亚利率震荡使澳大利亚央行的无线电沉默受到关注
item.description: 在澳大利亚央行周二做出利率决定之前的七周里，澳大利亚央行的政策制定者们一直保持沉默，因为中东的热战和美国的贸易战动摇了全球信心。【原文：In the seven weeks leading up to the Australian central bank interest rate decision Tuesday, its policymakers sat silent as hot wars in the Middle East and trade wars from the US shook global confidence.】

item.title: 电动汽车竞赛举步维艰，气候行动在优先事项清单上排名靠后
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日通讯。今天，Luz Ding 将关注 Formula E 在可持续发展和环保意识日益淡薄的大环境下的命运。此外，请订阅彭博社的《体育商业》时事通讯，了解权力、金钱与体育碰撞的背景。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Luz Ding looks at Formula E’s fortunes in a climate of diminishing interest in sustainability and environmental awareness. Also, sign up for Bloomberg's Business of Sports newsletter for the context you need on the collision of power, money and sports.】

item.title: 特朗普关税警告信扰乱航运旺季
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一发布了第一轮贸易信函，为十多个国家设定了新税率，同时将 "对等 "关税的最后期限推迟到 8 月 1 日。【原文：President Donald Trump issued his first round of trade letters Monday, setting new rates for more than a dozen countries, while pushing back the deadline for “reciprocal” tariffs until Aug 1.】

item.title: 特朗普致全球的信威胁关税之痛
item.description: 我是克雷格-斯特林（Craig Stirling），法兰克福资深编辑。今天我们将关注唐纳德-特朗普的最新贸易大炮。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Craig Stirling, a senior editor in Frankfurt. Today we’re looking at Donald Trump’s latest trade salvos. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 暗杀阴谋发生后，住院参议员在哥伦比亚民调中高居榜首
item.description: 上个月，反对党总统候选人米格尔-乌里韦（Miguel Uribe）遭遇未遂谋杀，哥伦比亚人团结起来支持他，将他推上了该国政治排行榜的首位。【原文：Colombians rallied behind opposition presidential candidate Miguel Uribe after an attempt on his life last month, propelling him to the top of the country’s political rankings.】

item.title: 中国 6 月汽车销量因补贴提高创历史新高
item.description: 随着天气转暖，6 月份通常是中国汽车销售的淡季，但上个月却一反常态，在主要城市暂停政府以旧换新补贴之前，买家纷纷寻求利用这一补贴，推动交易量创下新高。【原文：June is typically a slow period for car sales in China as the warmer weather kicks in but last month bucked that trend, with buyers seeking to take advantage of a government trade-in subsidy before it was suspended in key cities pushing transactions to a record.】

item.title: 开罗电信枢纽发生致命火灾造成大面积中断
item.description: 开罗市中心一家重要的电话交换中心发生大火，造成至少四人死亡，另有 27 人受伤，网络服务中断，当地证券交易所被迫取消周二的交易时段。【原文：A blaze at a key downtown Cairo telephone exchange left at least four people dead and another 27 injured, cutting off network services and forcing the local stock exchange to cancel Tuesday’s trading session.】

item.title: H2O America 接近 5.4 亿美元的德克萨斯州水务交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，H2O America 正在就收购竞争对手 Quadvest 供水和污水处理公司的资产进行深入谈判，这项交易将提升其在快速增长的得克萨斯州市场的影响力。【原文：H2O America is in advanced talks to buy the assets of rival water and wastewater utility Quadvest in a transaction that would boost its presence in the fast-growing Texas market, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 日本供应忧虑再起，国债随全球债券下跌
item.description: 美国国债下跌，受累于全球较长期限债券的抛售，因为市场担心日本可能会增加售债。【原文：US Treasuries fell, caught up in a global selloff of longer-maturity bonds as concern Japan may boost debt sales rippled across markets.】

item.title: 英国财政报告称，养老金购买减少，英国将面临 220 亿英镑的打击
item.description: 由于养老金计划购买的金边债券减少，英国面临着政府债务利息支出激增 220 亿英镑（299 亿美元）的风险，这使得英国严重依赖外国投资者抢购公共债务。【原文：Britain is at risk of a £22 billion ($29.9 billion) surge in the government’s debt-interest bill as pension schemes buy fewer gilts, making the country heavily dependent on foreign investors to snap up public debt.】

item.title: 亚马逊卖家抑制 Prime Day 折扣，关税带来冲击
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）的 "Prime Day "正在与唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的贸易战发生冲突，不断变化的关税促使一些品牌退出夏季促销活动，一些购物者也暗示他们计划退出。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s Prime Day is slamming into President Donald Trump’s trade war, with ever-shifting tariffs prompting some brands to sit out the summer sale and some shoppers dropping hints they plan to pull back.】

item.title: 特朗普税改法案出台前美国小型企业乐观情绪略有下降
item.description: 6 月份，美国小企业的信心略有下降，因为在特朗普政府赢得重大立法胜利之前，企业主继续担心税收问题。【原文：Sentiment among US small businesses fell slightly in June as owners continued to worry about taxes ahead of a major legislative win for the Trump administration.】

item.title: 支出激增，高盛、汇丰提示德国债券风险
item.description: 随着德国政府推动支出，债务供应增加，并支持经济增长，一些全球最大的银行对德国政府债券发出了新的警告。【原文：Some of the world’s biggest banks are sending fresh warnings on German government bonds as the country’s spending push drives up debt supply and supports economic growth.】

item.title: S&P 500 指数反弹仍将许多股票抛在后面
item.description:
S&P500指数中仅有10%的股票为其回报提供动力。【原文：

Just 10% of the S&P 500’s stocks are powering its returns.  

】
